{"job_description": "Product Manager II, Applied AI
Product Management, Product
San Francisco, California   |   Sunnyvale, California
Apply Now
About the Role

Uber Eats is transforming the way local businesses operate, grow, and connect with their customers. Merchants are at the heart of our ecosystem, and we are building the next generation of AI-powered capabilities and solutions to help them seamlessly run and scale their businesses.

As a Product Manager on the Applied AI team, you will be responsible for shaping and delivering AI-driven products that empower merchants with insights, recommendations, automation, and support. You will partner closely with engineering, data science, design, and operations teams to ensure we’re applying cutting-edge AI technologies in practical ways that solve real merchant problems. This is a highly cross-functional role where you will drive both strategy and execution, bringing together user needs, technical capabilities, and business goals.

What the Candidate Will Do

Define and deliver AI capabilities that improve merchant operations, growth, and overall experience on Uber Eats.
Partner with AI/ML engineers and data scientists to design and ship solutions that leverage advanced ML and Generative AI, from conversational experience to intelligent recommendations
Deeply understand merchant needs, turning insights from user research, feedback, and data into product requirements and roadmaps.
Establish a shared vision across Applied AI and Merchant Product, building consensus on priorities and driving alignment.
Balance innovation with execution by making informed tradeoffs across technical feasibility, user value, and business impact.
Measure impact and iterate, using data-driven analysis to improve product performance and inform future investments.
Clearly communicate product plans, strategy, and results to stakeholders across technical and non-technical functions, including senior leadership.
Basic Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business or a related technical/analytical field.
3+ years of product management experience, including delivering successful and innovative AI/ML products.
Experience working with applied AI/ML systems and translating technical solutions into intuitive, user-centric products and experience
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with comfort working in fast-paced, ambiguous environments.
Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional teams, from ideation to launch.
Preferred Qualifications

MBA or Master’s degree in a technical or analytical field.
Experience building AI/ML-powered products ideally in commerce or marketplaces
Familiarity with emerging Generative AI technologies and their applications to business workflows and user experiences
Strong customer empathy, with experience conducting B2B or SMB-focused research and translating insights into solutions.
Exceptional communication skills, capable of influencing across organizational boundaries.
A "driver" personality- constantly pushing toward clarity and delivery, while balancing the need for great collaboration.
For San Francisco, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$161,000 per year - USD$179,000 per year.

For Sunnyvale, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$161,000 per year - USD$179,000 per year.

For all US locations, you will be eligible to participate in Uber's bonus program, and may be offered an equity award & other types of comp. You will also be eligible for various benefits. More details can be found at the following link https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits.

Uber's mission is to reimagine the way the world moves for the better. Here, bold ideas create real-world impact, challenges drive growth, and speed fuels progress. What moves us, moves the world - let's move it forward, together.

Uber is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

Partner with AI/ML engineers and data scientists to design and ship solutions that leverage advanced ML and Generative AI, from conversational experience to intelligent recommendations
Deeply understand merchant needs, turning insights from user research, feedback, and data into product requirements and roadmaps.
Establish a shared vision across Applied AI and Merchant Product, building consensus on priorities and driving alignment.
Balance innovation with execution by making informed tradeoffs across technical feasibility, user value, and business impact.
Measure impact and iterate, using data-driven analysis to improve product performance and inform future investments.
Clearly communicate product plans, strategy, and results to stakeholders across technical and non-technical functions, including senior leadership.
Basic Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business or a related technical/analytical field.
3+ years of product management experience, including delivering successful and innovative AI/ML products.
Experience working with applied AI/ML systems and translating technical solutions into intuitive, user-centric products and experience
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with comfort working in fast-paced, ambiguous environments.
Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional teams, from ideation to launch.
Preferred Qualifications

MBA or Master’s degree in a technical or analytical field.
Experience building AI/ML-powered products ideally in commerce or marketplaces
Familiarity with emerging Generative AI technologies and their applications to business workflows and user experiences
Strong customer empathy, with experience conducting B2B or SMB-focused research and translating insights into solutions.
Exceptional communication skills, capable of influencing across organizational boundaries.
A "driver" personality- constantly pushing toward clarity and delivery, while balancing the need for great collaboration.
For San Francisco, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$161,000 per year - USD$179,000 per year.

For Sunnyvale, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$161,000 per year - USD$179,000 per year.

For all US locations, you will be eligible to participate in Uber's bonus program, and may be offered an equity award & other types of comp. You will also be eligible for various benefits. More details can be found at the following link https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits.
